comments.body: Maybe also add a `within` extension method for int?
I will use a `clampInt` in an upcoming PR (once implicit-cast false is everywhere)

This is looking good. Let's add some more documentation here that explains the two different behaviors, using childAspectRatio (the default) and using mainAxisExtent.

Adding a dartpad example of each would be awesome and easy for folks to play with and see the difference in action, There are examples like that in the code that are wrapped in a `{@tool dartpad ...`
We also need to update the docs above to match this.

Hrm, looks like I did this in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/60726 which was resolving a bunch of trivial bugs. Looks like https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/13861 was the motivation... but looking now 7 months later I am not sure it makes sense. Or at least I cannot remember. Let me check a few things to see if I can jog my memory. ðŸ˜•

Ah, that change was to assert the `crossAxisExtent` of the SliverConstraints provided to `performLayout`. This is a contradiction on `maxCrossAxisExtent`.
I did a bit of archaeology, and it looks like the constructor assert was added in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/9945 which asserts it is >= 0
At that point the assert that `maxCrossAxisExtent > 0` was already in `_debugAssertIsValid`, originating all the way back in #7780
So I think this is a bug that has been around for quite a while! Nice find @chinmoy12c!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +448,452 @@    this.childAspectRatio = 1.0,
    this.mainAxisExtent,
  }) : assert(maxCrossAxisExtent != null && maxCrossAxisExtent > 0),
       assert(mainAxisSpacing != null && mainAxisSpacing >= 0),
       assert(crossAxisSpacing != null && crossAxisSpacing >= 0),
